goal:
Polskie Górnictwo Naftowe i Gazownictwo SA is the leader of the Polish natural gas market. PGNiG SA is listed on the Warsaw Stock Exchange as part of WIG 20, the index of the largest Polish companies. The company’s core business includes exploration and production of natural gas and crude oil fields and, through its key subsidiaries, import, storage, sale and distribution of gaseous and liquid fuels, as well as generation of heat and electricity.

PGNiG SA has a stake almost 30 companies, including entities providing professional geophysical, drilling and maintenance services, highly esteemed on international markets.

PGNiG SA has branches in Russia, Belgium, Pakistan, Belarus, and Ukraine. PGNiG SA is also the sole owner of PGNiG Upstream International AS, a company engaged in exploring and operating deposits on the Norwegian Continental Shelf and the Norwegian Sea, POGC - Libya BV, a company engaged in exploring hydrocarbon deposits in the Murzuq Basin in Libya, PGNiG Sales & Trading GmbH based in Munich, a company engaged in gas trading and PGNiG Finance AB based in Stockholm, which issues Eurobonds on the European market. Within PGNiG Capital Group a branch of PGNiG Supply&Trading involved in international LNG trading operates in London, UK.
interests: Climate Action, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Internal Market, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Taxation, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives:
Main EU activities include monitoring and analysis of changes in the European Union legislature with particular attention paid to all changes which may affect PGNiG's existence on the European market.

2030 Framework for Climate and Energy Policies, Emission Trading Scheme – back-load Decision and structural reform of the scheme, Capacity Remuneration Mechanisms (CRMs), Implementation of 3rd legislative package on internal gas market (i.a.ENTSOG's Network Codes) Retail market design, Distribution, Energy Infrastructure, Energy Efficiency, Financial Legislation (MIFID, EMIR, REMIT, MAD), Environmental Legislation (Groundwater Directive; Water Framework Directive; Mining Waste Directive; REACH; Biocides legislation; Environmental Impact Assessment; Strategic Environmental Assessment; Environment Liability Directive, LCP BREF, HC BREF), Renewable Energy Directive, Microgeneration.
PGNiG SA has been involved in works under energy packages (issued by the EC in 2016) and Quo vadis gas? process carried out by the EC.
